        public void print(@NonNull
                  Panel panel,
                  Point from,
                  Point to)
        Prints a line on the screen of a panel.
        Parameters:
        panel - The panel.
        from - The start point of the line.
        to - The end point of the line.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the panel is null.

      • print

                  Screen screen,
                  Point from,

        Prints a line on a screen.
        Parameters:

        from - The start point of the line.
        to - The end point of the line.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the panel is null.

      • print

        public void print(@NonNull
                  Panel panel,
                  @NonNull
                  Point[] points)
        Prints one or more lines on the screen of a panel using a set of points. The algorithm requires a minimum of two points. The algorithm draws a line from the first point to the second point, then from the second point to the third point, and so on.
        Parameters:
        panel - The panel.
        points - The points.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the panel or points array is null.

      • print

        public void print(@NonNull
                  Screen screen,
                  @NonNull
                  Point[] points)
        Prints one or more lines on a screen using a set of points. The algorithm requires a minimum of two points. The algorithm draws a line from the first point to the second point, then from the second point to the third point, and so on.
        Parameters:
        screen - The screen.
        points - The points.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If there are fewer than two points.
        NullPointerException - If the screen or points array is null.
